result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman I Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Norman I Hopkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Norman I Hopkins in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #2 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $267.50-to be paid at $25.00 per month, commencing 9/1/16, alternate 5 days jail if not paid.  Count #1 is dismissed and read-in.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Dated today, from the State to Judge Carter, requesting to have jury trial set for 06/28/16 rescheduled due to witness unavailability.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 06-28-2016 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 06-23-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Norman I Hopkins in court with Attorney Cameron Weitzner.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests a jury status and jury trial date. Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 03/01/16.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 03:00 pm
to appear filed by Attorney Cameraon Weitzner

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Norman I Hopkins did not appear.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitzner requests a plea and sentence date.  Court quashes warrant and re-instates bail. (should have been quashed on 12/7/16)  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing at 01-08-2016 10:30 am

Case called at 8:55 a.m. Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   Defendant Norman I Hopkins did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weitnzer does not know why Defendant does not appear today.  Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordered revoked and forfeited.

Case re-called at 9:00 a.m..  Defendant now appears.  All other appearances remain the same.  Court quashes capias and re-instates bail.  Attorney Weitzner requests an adjournment.     Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing at 12-07-2015 08:30 am

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim listed in the criminal complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court, defendant Norman I Hopkins in court, in custody.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
